Well....it appears that if the file name has a \ in the name the upload fails. Will confirm with @Chris Heywood but appears to be working now that I've removed that.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596051392810,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-168","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-99","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Confirmed! This issue isn't due to photo file size but due to the characters in the photo file names, particularly the \ character, but the Xact API also errors if filenames include any of the following characters: <>:"/\\|?*.
Not only that, the Xact API (which must be using a Windows server in the chain at some point) errors if the filename happens to be any of the following: CON, PRN, AUX, NUL, COM1, COM2, COM3, COM4, COM5, COM6, COM7, COM8, COM9, LPT1, LPT2, LPT3, LPT4, LPT5, LPT6, LPT7, LPT8, LPT9
So a photo named aux.png will error, for example.
I've added validation to the OnDemand API now (that send the photos/documents to the Xact API) to check for any of those characters/strings that Xact can't handle and will automatically make them safe. So the OnDemand app can continue to use those characters/string and the photos/documents will flow into Xact without errors.
In the Xact test environment I've rerun the batch that previously failed due to \ characters in the filenames (per state machine https://console.aws.amazon.com/states/home?region=us-east-1#/executions/details/arn:aws:states:us-east-1:293415089511:execution:OnDemandAddAttachments:82065572-b022-45a6-8717-1edfa4807b23) and all 56 photos were successfully sent to Xact, see https://beta.xactanalysis.com/apps/xactanalysis/detail.jsp?mfn=006VZ3Q&ddid=006VZ3Q&xlink=true#d_imgdigital (per state machine https://console.aws.amazon.com/states/home?region=us-east-1#/executions/details/arn:aws:states:us-east-1:293415089511:execution:OnDemandAddAttachments:TEST-71928e3d-3093-fc0e-b0b2-9001dffe054a)

Hey @Kris Anolfo, I can't find details of the billing calc that is gonna need to be done in TV using the stories, pitch & field inspector / drone resource information.
Wondering if we're gonna need the stories / pitch to be numeric? E.g. if the billing calc is gonna include anything like stories >= where it relies on doing numeric operation?
In the OnDemand MySQL database I'm seeing that assignment_property_data has the stories/pre_dominate_pitch/steepest_pitch columns as varchar(255) data types, although where the stories has so far been populated so far it's actually numeric (there are no examples of the pitch columns being populated so far).
Any thoughts on how we'll need the data to be structured in TV? E.g. are simple text values going to be adequate?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596109458935,"updated":1596109694970,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-170","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Hey again @Kris Anolfo, on a similar note, what data do we need stored on each claim in TV for the field inspector / drone resource? For example, for each claim in TV we could just have:

  • Field Inspector ID
  • Field Inspector Name
  • Drone Resource ID
  • Drone Resource Name
    Each of those IDs could maybe just be the id from the users table in the OnDemand MySQL database (since that's where this info is gonna be coming from to start with).
    Or is there a bunch of other info that would be needed for billing? E.g. an actual Employee ID and/or each person's email address or other stuff?
    If there are many additional data points needed for each person then we'll need to decide whether we handle that by either:
  1. adding those data points into the OnDemand database so it can send that info over to TV for each claim; or
  2. setting up a central, linked table in TV that stores this info for each person but with a sync process or link identifier to hook into the OnDemand database, e.g. so TV gets a user ID from OnDemand and can link that to its person table to infer the other data points.
    Option 1 seems like it might be easiest/best but it would rely it being possible to maintain that data in the OnDemand app (it limits our reliance on maintaining key data in TV though?).
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596112161020,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-171","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Another consideration on this is that for each carrier in OnDemand it's ideally going to need to tell any new API I set-up what the relevant TrackVia "View ID" is when it's sending over any claim data. The TV API will need that because these claims are stored in separate client apps/tables in TrackVia, e.g. there's a different app and different table/view for SFI versus other clients, etc. So, maybe, the carriers table in OnDemand is going to need to have a tv_view_id column added to it so it can pass that along with any request to update a claim in TV.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596114096655,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-174","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I'm dropping these instructions I received from Falin in here for our discussion about this:

Billing
Each file will be billed at $300 per file for the pilot and then $385 after the pilot. It may make sense to have drop down and do a calculated field that will reduce if that drop down says (pilot).   We will be automatically generating the billing invoices from the On Demand System -> XA but need to track for A/R

Fees
For the Field Inspectors / Drone Resources -  their name/email should be pushed from the On Demand Web Application (it will be attached to the specific claim number)

For the Desk Adjuster - their information will push over as the XACTNET address.  So Maxwell or whoever will need to continue to add adjusters to that linked XACTNET Adjusters app

Calculated Fee to be paid to Field Inspector / Drone Resources:
1 Story Inspection: $95.00
2 Stories or More: $20.00 add on
Pitch > 7/12: $40 add on

For Example:  2 Story 9/12 Roof would be $155.

Flat Fee to be paid to the Desk Adjuster:

$95.00 per file

    public function dronePilot () {

    /**

    public function fieldInspector () {

Hey @Kris Anolfo, I can't find details of the billing calc that is gonna need to be done in TV using the stories, pitch & field inspector / drone resource information.
Wondering if we're gonna need the stories / pitch to be numeric? E.g. if the billing calc is gonna include anything like stories >= where it relies on doing numeric operation?
In the OnDemand MySQL database I'm seeing that assignment_property_data has the stories/pre_dominate_pitch/steepest_pitch columns as varchar(255) data types, although where the stories has so far been populated so far it's actually numeric (there are no examples of the pitch columns being populated so far).
Any thoughts on how we'll need the data to be structured in TV? E.g. are simple text values going to be adequate?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596109458935,"updated":1596109694970,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-170","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Hey again @Kris Anolfo, on a similar note, what data do we need stored on each claim in TV for the field inspector / drone resource? For example, for each claim in TV we could just have:

  • Field Inspector ID
  • Field Inspector Name
  • Drone Resource ID
  • Drone Resource Name
    Each of those IDs could maybe just be the id from the users table in the OnDemand MySQL database (since that's where this info is gonna be coming from to start with).
    Or is there a bunch of other info that would be needed for billing? E.g. an actual Employee ID and/or each person's email address or other stuff?
    If there are many additional data points needed for each person then we'll need to decide whether we handle that by either:
  1. adding those data points into the OnDemand database so it can send that info over to TV for each claim; or
  2. setting up a central, linked table in TV that stores this info for each person but with a sync process or link identifier to hook into the OnDemand database, e.g. so TV gets a user ID from OnDemand and can link that to its person table to infer the other data points.
    Option 1 seems like it might be easiest/best but it would rely it being possible to maintain that data in the OnDemand app (it limits our reliance on maintaining key data in TV though?).
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596112161020,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-171","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Another consideration on this is that for each carrier in OnDemand it's ideally going to need to tell any new API I set-up what the relevant TrackVia "View ID" is when it's sending over any claim data. The TV API will need that because these claims are stored in separate client apps/tables in TrackVia, e.g. there's a different app and different table/view for SFI versus other clients, etc. So, maybe, the carriers table in OnDemand is going to need to have a tv_view_id column added to it so it can pass that along with any request to update a claim in TV.

I'm dropping these instructions I received from Falin in here for our discussion about this:

Billing
Each file will be billed at $300 per file for the pilot and then $385 after the pilot. It may make sense to have drop down and do a calculated field that will reduce if that drop down says (pilot).   We will be automatically generating the billing invoices from the On Demand System -> XA but need to track for A/R

Fees
For the Field Inspectors / Drone Resources -  their name/email should be pushed from the On Demand Web Application (it will be attached to the specific claim number)

For the Desk Adjuster - their information will push over as the XACTNET address.  So Maxwell or whoever will need to continue to add adjusters to that linked XACTNET Adjusters app

Calculated Fee to be paid to Field Inspector / Drone Resources:
1 Story Inspection: $95.00
2 Stories or More: $20.00 add on
Pitch > 7/12: $40 add on

For Example:  2 Story 9/12 Roof would be $155.

Flat Fee to be paid to the Desk Adjuster:

$95.00 per file
